source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers white, pink, red or purplish; leaflets uniform or dimorphic
Flowers yellow, sometimes streaked with red or purple; leaflets dimorphic, 2 basal leaflets ovate, 3 terminal leaflets obovate
Leaflets dimorphic, 2 basal leaflets ovate, 3 terminal leaflets obovate; pod with papery wings c. 2 mm wide
Leaflets all obovate; pod not winged
Plant erect or ascending; leaflets mostly 8–40 mm long; inflorescences 2–8-flowered; flowers 10–22 mm long; keel obtusely curved along lower edge; calyx 5–12 mm long
Plant prostrate or ascending; leaflets mostly 10–15 mm long; inflorescences 1–4-flowered; flowers 6–9 mm long; keel abruptly angled on lower edge; calyx 4–5 mm long
Plant glabrous or densely or sparsely hairy with a greenish appearance; leaf rachis more than 3 mm long; calyx campanulate, teeth more or less equal
Plant densely silky-hairy with a greyish appearance; leaf rachis 1–2.5 mm long; calyx bilabiate, teeth distinctly unequal
Plant annual, densely hairy with dense long spreading hairs; flowers 4–10 mm long; calyx teeth much longer than calyx tube
Plant perennial, glabrous, appressed-hairy or with sparse spreading hairs; flowers 7–14 mm long; calyx teeth longer or shorter than calyx tube
Lower edge of keel bent at right-angles near middle; pod 1–1.5 mm wide, more than 4 times the length of the calyx
Lower edge of keel obtusely curved from base; pod 1.5–2 mm wide, less than 3 times the length of the calyx
Leaflets with distinct veins; inflorescences 8–14-flowered; calyx teeth spreading in bud, equal to or shorter than tube
Leaflets with indistinct veins; inflorescences 1–6-flowered; calyx teeth erect in bud, longer or shorter than tube
Leaflets 2.5–12 mm long; calyx 5–7 mm long; calyx teeth equal to or shorter than calyx tube
Leaflets 7–20 mm long; calyx 7–9 mm long; calyx teeth c. 1.5 times longer than calyx tube
